sitePolicy.title: Site Policy
sitePolicy.subtitle: Terms of use, privacy, and policies for the Lecture Management System (LMS) platform.

termsOfUse.title: Terms of Use
paragraphs: By accessing and using this Learning Management System (LMS), you agree to comply with these Terms of Use. This platform is intended for educational purposes and is provided to students, lecturers, and administrators of participating institutions.

You must use your assigned credentials to access the system. Do not share your login information with others. You are responsible for all activity that occurs under your account. Unauthorized access, misuse, or distribution of course materials outside the platform may result in disciplinary action by your institution.

Course content, including lectures, assignments, and materials, is the property of the institution and/or the respective lecturers. You may not reproduce, distribute, or commercialize this content without explicit permission.

privacy.title: Privacy Policy
paragraphs: We are committed to protecting your privacy. This LMS collects and processes personal data necessary for academic administration, including your name, student or lecturer ID, email, enrollment records, grades, and usage logs.

Your data is used to: manage course enrollments, record grades and attendance, send notifications, generate academic reports, and improve platform functionality. Data is stored securely and retained according to institutional and regulatory requirements.

We do not sell or share your personal information with third parties for marketing purposes. Data may be shared with authorized institutional staff, auditors, or as required by law. We use encryption and access controls to safeguard your information.
You may request access to or correction of your personal data through your institution's data protection officer or administrative office.

acceptableUse.title: Acceptable Use Policy
acceptableUse.intro: Users must use the LMS in a manner consistent with academic integrity and institutional policies. Prohibited activities include:
items: Sharing account credentials or impersonating others
Attempting to access data or systems without authorization
Submitting plagiarized work or engaging in academic dishonesty
Uploading malicious software or harmful content
Harassing, bullying, or discriminating against other users
Using the platform for non-academic commercial purposes
acceptableUse.outro: Violations may result in account suspension, grade penalties, or institutional disciplinary proceedings.

sections.title: Academic Integrity
sections.body: All work submitted through this platform must be your own. Proper citation and attribution are required when referencing external sources. Plagiarism, cheating, and collusion are strictly prohibited and will be reported to your institution.

sections.title: Enrollment & Withdrawal
sections.body: Course enrollment is subject to availability, prerequisites, and institutional enrollment periods. Students must adhere to add/drop deadlines. Late withdrawals require approval from your department or academic advisor.

sections.title: Grade Disputes
sections.body: If you believe a grade has been recorded incorrectly, contact the course lecturer first. Unresolved disputes may be escalated to your department head or the institution's academic affairs office according to institutional policy.

sections.title: System Availability
sections.body: We strive for high availability but cannot guarantee uninterrupted access. Scheduled maintenance will be announced in advance when possible. Plan ahead for deadlines during peak periods.

items.question: How do I enroll in a course?
items.answer: Navigate to the Courses page, browse available courses for the current semester, and click 'Enroll' on the course you wish to take. Enrollment is subject to availability and any prerequisites set by your department.

items.question: How can I view my grades?
items.answer: Log in to your dashboard and go to My Courses. Select a course to view your grades for assignments, quizzes, and final assessments. Grades are typically updated by lecturers within two weeks of submission.

items.question: What should I do if I forgot my password?
items.answer: Contact your institution's IT support or administrator. Account credentials are managed by your institution, and password resets must be processed through the administrative portal.

items.question: Can I drop a course after enrolling?
items.answer: Yes, during the enrollment period you can drop courses from your My Courses page. After the enrollment window closes, you must contact your department or academic advisor to request a course withdrawal.

items.question: How do lecturers upload course materials?
items.answer: Lecturers can upload documents, slides, and resources through the course management interface. Materials are then visible to enrolled students in the course view.

items.question: Is my academic data secure?
items.answer: Yes. We use industry-standard encryption for data in transit and at rest. Access is role-based, and all actions are logged for audit purposes. See our Privacy section for full details.

privacy.title: Privacy Policy
privacy.subtitle: Your privacy is important to us. This policy explains how we collect, use, and protect your personal information in the Lecture Management System.
privacy.intro: The Lecture Management System (LMS) is committed to protecting the privacy of students, lecturers, and administrators. This Privacy Policy describes our practices regarding the collection, use, and disclosure of information through our platform. By using our services, you agree to the collection and use of information in accordance with this policy.
collectContent: **Account Information**: When you register, we collect your name, email address, student/lecturer ID, and department affiliation.
**Academic Data**: Course enrollments, grades, attendance records, and academic schedules.
**Usage Data**: Login times, pages visited, and features used to improve our services.
**Uploaded Content**: Documents, course materials, and profile images you choose to upload.
useContent: **Academic Services**: To provide course enrollment, grade tracking, scheduling, and other educational features.
**Communication**: To send notifications about courses, grades, announcements, and system updates.
**System Improvement**: To analyze usage patterns and improve the platform's functionality and user experience.
**Administrative Purposes**: To manage user accounts, verify identities, and maintain system security.
sharingContent: **Within the Institution**: Your academic information is shared with relevant faculty, administrators, and departments as necessary for educational purposes.
**Lecturers**: Can view enrolled students' names, IDs, and academic performance in their courses.
**Students**: Cannot access other students' personal information or grades.
**Third Parties**: We do not sell or share your personal information with external parties for marketing purposes.
securityContent: **Encryption**: All data is encrypted in transit using TLS/SSL and at rest using industry-standard encryption.
**Access Control**: Role-based access ensures users only see information relevant to their role (student, lecturer, or admin).
**Authentication**: Secure login with hashed passwords and session management.
**Regular Audits**: We conduct security reviews to identify and address potential vulnerabilities.
rightsContent: **Access**: You can view and download your personal data through your account settings.
**Correction**: Request corrections to inaccurate personal information by contacting support.
**Notifications**: Manage your notification preferences in account settings.
**Account Deletion**: Contact your institution's administrator to request account deletion (subject to academic record retention policies).
retentionContent: **Active Accounts**: Your data is retained while your account is active.
**Academic Records**: Grades and enrollment history may be retained according to institutional policies and legal requirements.
**Inactive Accounts**: Accounts inactive for extended periods may be archived or deleted per institutional policy.
**Backups**: Secure backups are maintained for disaster recovery purposes.
privacy.contactDesc: If you have any questions about this Privacy Policy or our data practices, please contact us through our support page.
privacy.footerNote: This privacy policy is subject to change. We will notify users of any significant changes through the platform.
